definition: drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to drink
to give (animals) water to drink
wine (esp. rice wine)/liquor/spirits/alcoholic beverage/CL:杯[bei1],瓶[ping2],罐[guan4],桶[tong3],缸[gang1]
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
happy/cheerful/to laugh
music
surname Le
surname Yue

sentences.english: But the truth is there was no drunken carousing more honorable and fruitful.
sentences.chinese: 但是實際上，飲酒作樂實在是人生的一大快事。

sentences.english: Prince daily and ZhangLiHua flirting, bender.
sentences.chinese: 太子每日與張麗華打情罵俏，飲酒作樂。

sentences.english: From then on, the king of Qi gave up his bad habit of drinking and playing all night.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後，齊威王改掉了整晚飲酒作樂的壞習慣。

sentences.english: They went on a binge last night and didn't get back until 3in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚他們出去飲酒作樂，直到今晨3點鐘纔回來。

sentences.english: They were drinking and reveling all night.
sentences.chinese: 他們整晚都在飲酒作樂。

sentences.english: Life is not all beer and skittle.
sentences.chinese: 生活並非飲酒作樂而已。

sentences.english: Anderson started out on his alcoholic binges at quite an early age.
sentences.chinese: 安德森很小就開始飲酒作樂了。

definition: pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to drink hard
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to die in battle (idiom)
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to play deaf-mute
(old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
battery-powered toy/(Tw) video game/computer game
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
